title: Identifying self-intersecting contours
content:
Hey guys,

Upon submitting some typefaces to a foundry, they sent me a reply with a list of things to tidy up the typeface.  
one of the suggestions was:

Vector Check — About a dozen self-intersecting contours that should be  
corrected. Correction time: 10 min.

My question is how do i identify this glyphs? what should i look for.

THANKS FELLAS.
author: hello_caleb

comments.content: The Microsoft Font Validator might help identify the glyphs. Alternately ask the foundry what tool they used to identify the issue or ask them for a more detailed report.
FontLab's Font Audit should help as well.

The next version of the Adobe FDK will contain a new tool that will find this sort of thing, too. Out in another month or so.

T
